intro: Chrozophora plicata var. rottleri, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and pinnately lobed. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family.
